Inventory Officer Job at Nettetal Nigeria Limited




        
    

        
        Nettetal Nigeria Limited isan eclectic 21stcentury luxury company that has thrived for more than 30 years with expressions in three major states in Nigeria; Abuja, Lagos and Port Harcourt.They proudly hold the exclusive Nigeria franchise of KARE Germany anda vast clientele across different sectors in Nigeiraand overseas.The company'smajor aim is to satisfy the luxury taste and price aspirations of theirclients and stakeholders across board.
     

            
    



Nettetal has a track record of excellent customer service and satisfaction, intergrity, adherence to world best practices and continous development in itssector. The team is professional, innovative, energetic, forward-thinking, ingenious, and loyal. Staff welfare and employing seasoned professionals to contribute to the success story is a priority. Nettetal look forward to having you join the team.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Inventory Officer

Job Location: Port Harcourt, Rivers
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description


	We are seeking for a detail-oriented and proactive Inventory Officer to join our Abuja and Port Harcourt team.
	The ideal candidate will be responsible for maintaining accurate stock records, coordinating product movement between branches, and ensuring seamless inventory management for our range of luxury furniture, home fragrances, lighting, and décor items.
	You will work closely with the sales and showroom teams to ensure product availability, proper display, and timely replenishment that reflects our brand’s commitment to excellence.


Responsibilities


	Guarantee accuracy and completeness of inventory records, keep an eye on and regulate inventory levels, track stock movements, and conduct routine stock counts.
	Acquire, examine, and document incoming inventory shipments, confirming the quantity, calibre, and state of the items in accordance with purchase orders or packing slips.
	Keep correct and up-to-date inventory records, update inventory databases, systems, or spreadsheets to reflect stock transactions, modifications, and movements.
	Estimate inventory needs, establish reorder points, and ascertain the ideal stock levels, examine demand trends, sales projections, and previous data.


Qualifications


	HND/BSc in Business Administration,Supply Chain Management, or any related field.
	1-3 years of proven experience in inventory, warehouse, or stock control
	Strong numerical and analytical skills.
	Good knowledge of inventory management systems and stock control procedures.
	Proficiency in Microsoft Excel and basic computer applications.
	High level of accuracy and attention to detail.
	Ability to prepare inventory reports and reconcile stock variances.
	Good organizational and record-keeping skills.
	Strong communication and interpersonal skills.
	Ability to work independently and under pressure.
	High level of integrity and accountability.


Other Requirements:


	Basic understanding of Inventory and supply chain processes.
	Willingness to learn and adapt to company systems and procedures.
	Physically fit to handle stock inspections when required.


Salary
N130,000 - N150,000 per month.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and a brief cover letter to: hr.nettetal@gmail.com using "Inventory Officer - Portharcourt”  as the subject of the email.

Note


	Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.
	The candidate must reside in Port Harcourt or be willing to relocate to Port Harcourt.
	The successful candidate will undergo training in Abuja with the Inventory Manager before resuming duties.

	Converting strategy into prioritised, executable initiatives

	Strengthening governance, execution discipline, and performance cadence

Business Transformation &amp; Strategic Execution:


	Drive the delivery of Bature Brewery&rsquo;s business transformation agenda, aligned to profitability, operational efficiency, governance maturity, and scalability
	Translate strategic priorities into structured programmes and projects with clear milestones, owners, and timelines
	Maintain an integrated view of transformation initiatives and ensure alignment across departments
	Identify execution risks early and work with senior leaders to resolve them
	Identify Business Sustainability elements and drive processes to eliminate risks and build into operational engagements


Programme &amp; Project Management (PMO Function):


	Act as the central point of coordination for strategic and cross-functional projects
	Own business initiatives (as the champion ) and prioritize execution based on strategic value, financial impact, and organisational capacity
	Ensure all Transformation projects have clear scope, success metrics, and reporting cadence
	Track progress rigorously and escalate issues where delivery is at risk
	Enforce discipline around project selection, sequencing, and closure


Executive Coordination &amp; Governance Cadence;


	Structure and coordinate executive meetings, monthly performance reviews, and key decision forums
	Prepare agendas, briefing materials, and decision papers
	Capture decisions, actions, and accountabilities, and ensure consistent follow-through
	Maintain visibility over executive priorities, risks, and interdependencies
	Draft internal summaries, updates, and briefing notes as required


Performance Management &amp; Reporting Discipline:


	Jointly own with the CFO the implementation and ongoing use of scorecards, KPIs, and performance dashboards
	Ensure timely, high-quality performance inputs from department heads
	Consolidate updates into clear, decision-focused executive summaries
	Work closely with the CFO and COO to reinforce a fact-based, accountability-driven performance culture


Cross-Functional Alignment &amp; Stakeholder Management:


	Act as an integrator across Operations, Production, Sales, Finance, F&amp;B, and External Relations
	Ensure alignment where priorities compete, or dependencies exist
	Support senior leaders by structuring communications and tracking commitments
	Enable collaboration without diluting functional accountability


What Success Looks Like (12&ndash;18 Months)


	Strategic initiatives are delivered on time and with clear ownership
	Executive meetings are decision-oriented with strong follow-through
	Leadership operates with clearer priorities and reduced friction
	Governance, reporting, and execution feel structured and predictable
	The business demonstrates improved operational discipline and scalability
	Business Sustainability index is within +/- 5%


Experience &amp; Background Required
5 to 7 years of experience in:


	Project, programme, or portfolio management
	Business transformation or strategy execution roles
	Experience working closely with Executives and senior leadership teams
	Proven track record delivering complex, cross-functional initiatives
	Strong exposure into strategy development and Risk management


Strongly Preferred:


	Experience in FMCG, hospitality, manufacturing, or multi-site operations
	Exposure to high-growth or scale-up environments
	Experience supporting governance or organisational transitions
	Strong commercial and financial literacy


Tools &amp; Systems (Preferred Experience):
Candidates should be comfortable operating in a modern, digital-first environment, with experience using or rapidly adopting the following tools:

Collaboration &amp; Communication:


	Slack
	Microsoft 365 (Outlook, Excel, PowerPoint, Teams)


Project &amp; Work Management:


	Project Management platforms equivalent to Asana, Click-up e.t.c
	Ability to design and enforce workflows, timelines, and accountability structures


Data, Reporting &amp; BI:


	Business Intelligence tools (e.g. Google Looker Studio, Power BI, Tableau)
	Strong Excel / spreadsheet capability for tracking, analysis, and reporting


AI &amp; Productivity Tools:


	Practical use of AI tools to improve productivity, documentation, analysis, and decision support
	Comfort experimenting with and embedding AI-enabled workflows


Skills &amp; Competencies:


	Strong execution discipline and prioritisation capability
	Excellent written and verbal communication
	Ability to bring structure to ambiguous situations
	High emotional intelligence and stakeholder management skills
	Comfortable engaging and constructively challenging senior leaders
	Detail-oriented with a strategic perspective


Personal Attributes:


	Calm, organised, and outcome-focused
	Proactive, accountable, and reliable
	Trusted and discreet
	Comfortable operating behind the scenes to drive visible results
	Comfortable being hands on within all levels of the organization


Method of Application&nbsp;
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and a brief cover letter outlining&nbsp;relevant leadership experience and measurable achievement&nbsp;to:&nbsp;Chiamaka@jpgramm.com&nbsp;and copy&nbsp;cynthia.onuoha@idyha.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the Subject of the email.
